sense.name: a vote, a public and legal choosing of officials
sense.examples: We stayed up late to watch the election returns. That city has a long history of running crooked elections. Jane hasn't decided who to vote for in the next election. People believe the election in Italy will be very close.

sense.name: a specific or personal act of choosing something
sense.examples: Mary's election of medicine as a profession pleased her father. The children's election to eat their chocolate now means they won't get dessert later.

sense.name: the state of having won a vote, being chosen for public office
sense.examples: We celebrated Bob's election to the state senate. What will her election mean for our town in terms of taxes? His election to a second term was quite frustrating for some.

sense.name: predestined divine salvation
sense.examples: The Calvinists believe the election to the next life is already decided, although we cannot know it. The preacher told him no money could buy his election to heaven.
